intro: Clitoria brachystegia, commonly known as the small-stemmed butterfly pea, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its distinctive pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces vibrant purple or blue flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland and savanna habitats. Clitoria brachystegia is also valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional uses in herbal medicine.
